title.value: Magnetoencephalography resting‐state correlates of executive and language components of verbal fluency
title.justification: This title accurately reflects the content and focus of the paper, which is exploring brain correlates through MEG in understanding verbal fluency components.
title.quote: Magnetoencephalography resting‐state correlates of executive and language components of verbal fluency

extractions.description: The study examines the resting state MEG correlates of the executive and language components of verbal fluency. It uses neuropsychological assessments and analyzes spectral power estimates to uncover correlation patterns in the brain.

type.justification: The paper reports on an empirical study where MEG data and statistical methods were applied to explore brain functioning in relation to verbal fluency.
type.quote: The purpose of this study was to elucidate the specificity of the resting state MEG correlates of the executive and language components.

name.justification: The paper investigates brain activity using neuroimaging techniques, focusing on neural correlates of cognitive functions like executive processing and language.
name.quote: The study examines the resting state MEG correlates of the executive and language components of verbal fluency.

name.justification: The research focuses on cognitive processes involved in executive functions and language abilities.
name.quote: Verbal fluency (VF) is a heterogeneous cognitive function that requires executive as well as language abilities.

name.justification: The paper utilizes this standardized neuropsychological test to assess verbal fluency.
name.quote: For verbal fluency, we used the Verbal Fluency-letter (VFL) subtest from the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced work is the source for the Verbal Fluency-letter test used in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For verbal fluency, we used the Verbal Fluency-letter (VFL) subtest from the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System.

name.value: Vocabulary subtests (VOC) from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale—4th Edition
name.justification: This dataset is used to evaluate verbal abilities in participants as part of the neuropsychological assessment.
name.quote: To assess verbal abilities, we used the Vocabulary subtests (VOC) from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale—4th Edition.

referenced_paper_title.value: Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale: Fourth Edition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The VOC subtests used in this research are sourced from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To assess verbal abilities, we used the Vocabulary subtests (VOC) from the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale—4th Edition.

name.justification: TMT is part of the testing battery to evaluate executive functioning in the study.
name.quote: As executive functioning test, we used the Trail Making Test Condition 4 (TMT) from the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Trail Making Test, like the VFL, is from the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System, indicating the referenced work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: As executive functioning test, we used the Trail Making Test Condition 4 (TMT) from the Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System.

name.justification: Brainstorm is mentioned as the software used for MEG data pre-processing in the study.
name.quote: MEG data pre-processing was performed using the Matlab-based Brainstorm open-source software.

referenced_paper_title.value: Brainstorm: A user-friendly application for MEG/EEG analysis
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to Brainstorm as the software used suggests the associated publication on its application and utility.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Brainstorm: A user-friendly application for MEG/EEG analysis.

name.justification: FreeSurfer is used for generating cortical surface models, which is crucial for the study's data processing.
name.quote: T1-weighted brain volumes... were used to generate a cortical surface model, using the FreeSurfer software package.

referenced_paper_title.value: Whole brain segmentation: Automated labeling of neuroanatomical structures in the human brain
referenced_paper_title.justification: FreeSurfer software, referenced for its use in brain imaging analysis, corresponds to its core publication.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Whole brain segmentation: Automated labeling of neuroanatomical structures in the human brain.
